newsitem.title: FINLAND: Baltic Ice - Levels steady, restrictions unchanged.
newsitem.headline: Baltic Ice - Levels steady, restrictions unchanged.

text.p: Ice levels were steady and restrictions to navigation were unchanged, the Finnish Institute of Marine Research said in its twice-weekly ice report on Tuesday.
One ice-breaker was assisting ships outside Loviisa, Kotka and Hamina, and five were in action near St Petersburg and Vyborg in the eastern Gulf of Finland.
Five ice-breakers were operating in the northern end of the Gulf of Bothnia and two in the middle, and one remained on station outside Parnu in the Gulf of Riga, the institute said.
PORT TEMP ICE TYPE THICKNESS RESTRICTIONSSt
Petersburg n/a Fast/ridged 20-50 Russian ice class 13,
Vyborg n/a Fast/ridged 30-40 Russian ice class 13,
Kotka,Hamina, n/a Consolidated/ 10-30 Ice classes I, II,
Oulu n/a Consolidated/ 50-70 Ice class IA,
Kemi n/a Consolidated/ 50-80 Ice class IA
Lulea n/a Fast/level 30-50 Ice class IA,
Umea n/a Consolidated 30-50 Ice class II
Kokkola, n/a Fast/compact/ 40-65 Ice class IA,
Vaasa n/a Fast 15-40 Ice classs IA, IB

NOTES: New ice - forming, thin and still moving. Fast ice - not moving level flat ice. Level ice - thick flat ice. Consolidated/compact - compact close ice. Windrow ice - reshaped by wind, thickness varies sharply. Rafted - ridges forming, 10-20 cm thick. Ridged - ridged or hummocked ice. Open - floes with water at rate of 4-6:10. Close ice - floes tightly packed.
